definitions.definition: a weapon that bullets or shells (= explosive containers) are fired from:
examples: The British police do not carry guns.

definitions.definition: in sport, a device that makes a very loud sudden noise as a signal to start a race:
examples: At the gun, the runners sprinted away down the track.

definitions.definition: a device that you hold in your hand and use for sending out a liquid or object:
a person who is paid to shoot and kill someone
to make an engine operate at a higher speed:
examples: You must have been really gunning the engine to get here on time.
